title: Next-generation nuclear reactors could get a boost from the National Defense Authorization Act
summary:
President Trump signed the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year 2026 Thursday with measures that further the bipartisan push for next-generation nuclear power plants.
The Trump administration has embraced the technology as a new energy source for data centers demanding greater amounts of electricity for AI.
Many Democrats, meanwhile, have championed smaller and ostensibly cheaper and easier-to-build nuclear reactors as a carbon pollution-free energy source that can help fight climate change.
The International Nuclear Energy Act establishes working groups and boosts funding and interagency cooperation on the development and export of US nuclear technologies.
The bill also directs the Department of Defense to create an executive agent role “for installation and operational nuclear energy.”

title: Scientists uncover potentially game-changing universal new benefit after planting mushrooms: 'Unsung hero'
summary:
As the BBC reported, the architecture firm Redhouse Studio developed a "mycotecture" method that uses fungal mycelium to break down toxic materials.
Redhouse Studio is changing the way people think about toxic demolition debris, construction scrap materials, and polluted soils.
This news is encouraging because it offers a natural solution to address mounting construction waste as development demand steadily increases.
Redhouse Studio has already been using its fungi technology to address housing and health crises in Cleveland, Ohio.
"Decades of racist city planning, banking, and industrial practices have poisoned communities and blighted neighborhoods," Redhouse Studio wrote.

title: Researchers raise concerns after discovering powerful ocean phenomenon: 'Expected to increase significantly'
summary:
As polar sea ice continues to shrink, small-scale churning and mixing in the Arctic Ocean are becoming stronger.
In a recent study published in the journal Nature Climate Change, researchers at the Institute for Basic Science examined the future of mesoscale horizontal stirring in the Arctic Ocean.
They discovered that as polar sea ice continues to melt due to rising global temperatures, the level of churning in the Arctic Ocean is intensifying.
"Nevertheless, if global warming continues, horizontal mixing is expected to increase significantly in both regions."
In an effort to combat rising global temperatures, many countries are enacting policies focused on reducing the use of fossil fuels.

title: Schools told to keep children inside as polluted fog envelops Bosnian capital
summary:
SARAJEVO, Bosnia-Herzegovina (AP) — Flights were cancelled, children were told to stay indoors and outdoors construction work was banned in Sarajevo Thursday as a thick layer of fog enveloped the Bosnian capital.
Advertisement AdvertisementAdvertisement AdvertisementThe Swiss air quality technology company IQAir on Thursday ranked air quality in Sarajevo as “unhealthy."
The city often tops the list of places with poor air quality globally.
Authorities on Wednesday banned trucks of over 3.5 tons in the Sarajevo city center along with cars and trucks that do not meet European Union environmental standards.
Any construction work outside has been banned as well as public gatherings.

title: Researchers sound alarm after discovering 'warning signal' in Dead Sea: 'It was a jarring moment'
summary:
The Press Service of Israel caught up with the authors of a study titled, "Warning signal from the Dead Sea: Plastic pollution at the deepest hypersaline lake."
Advertisement AdvertisementAdvertisement AdvertisementThe researchers relayed that the Kidron Stream is taking heaping amounts of trash from Jerusalem to the Dead Sea.
Newer formations of plastic trash called "plastic rings" are now reaching hundreds of kilograms in size.
If left alone, plastic pollution could completely take over the area, making getting to the Dead Sea difficult.
Advertisement AdvertisementAdvertisement AdvertisementTheir work in documenting just how bad the problem is getting at the Dead Sea should play a large role in the education front.
